clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Lung Recruitment and End-expiratory Lung Collapse in Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Lung Recruitment and End-expiratory Lung Collapse in Patients With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: In this study gas-exchange and respiratory mechanics variations to PEEP change will be correlated to CT lung morphological modifications assessed at different airway pressures (5, 15, 30 and 45 cmH2O).

primary_outcome.measure: Computer Tomography (CT) scan lung recruitment and CT lung weight
primary_outcome.description: Aim of the study is to determine the relationship between the opening pressures (recruitment) and closing pressures (PEEP) in order to prevent the opening and closing of the lung parenchyma

arm_group.description: Sedated and mechanically ventilated patients admitted to ICU

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to ICU with diagnosis of ARDS who required mechanical ventilation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of acute lung injury/ acute respiratory distress syndrome
- Mechanical ventilation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
- Clinical diagnosis of pneumothorax
- Haemodynamic instability
